titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Records of Religious and Benevolent Societies, Organizations, and Meetings
Religious and Benevolent Societies, Organizations, and Meetings, Records of
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 22:17

did.unittitle: Records of Religious and Benevolent Societies, Organizations, and Meetings
did.abstract: This collection contains publications of primarily American and British organizations, societies, conferences, and councils. The publications provide primary source documentation of organizations that focused on a wide variety of issues, ranging from sabbath observance to tract and Bible distribution to support of widows to religious education to ecumenical programs, etc.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Records of Religious and Benevolent Societies, Organizations, and Meetings (RG 34), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The publications in this collection date from the early 19th century to the 1980s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Record Group 34 consists of primarily printed material. This guide lists the organizations and conferences alphabetically by name, with dates and place of origin also noted.
The religious and benevolent societies and organizations represented in this collection generally fit into one or more of the following categories:

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The societies and organizations are listed alphabetically:

did.unittitle: Hampshire Society for Promoting Religion in the County and its Vicinity

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Hannah Gray was an African American seamstress in New Haven who upon her death in 1861 bequeathed her home for the use of indigent elderly women of color. The Home was supported and run by the Women's Twentieth Century Club. The Hannah Gray home continues to serve low-income elderly persons in need of residential care.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material includes correspondence, reports, committee records, fundraising and financial records, operational documents.
